dc_description_s: Green Buildings (LEED) The LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) Green Building Rating System? is a voluntary Members of the U.S. Green Building Council representing all segments of the building industry developed LEED and continue to contribute to its evolution. LEED was created to: * Define "green building" by establishing a common standard of measurement * Promote integrated Based on well-founded scientific standards LEED recognizes achievements and promotes expertise in green building through a comprehensive system offering project certification All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
